text:
Hi. I have a question regarding the CTAs. We have a website which is not in HubSpot. On this website you can open an internal page directly in a popup. Now the clients want to use the CTAs from HubSpot. When you create a CTA, you have to choose a destination page which is internal (in HubSpot) or external (websites not hosted on HubSpot). Choosing an external page builds this process:
CTas on our website --> click --> goes to HubSpot --> grab tracking parameters --> go back to our website with the parameters. Because of this redirect logic, the popup doesn't work. In order to keep the popup function and add a specific tracking to some CTAs, I would like to use the custom events.
Do you have any better idea?
Go to the file manager and hit download, it downloads the original :slightly_smiling_face:
<@ULB541FJ8> the status is set to the contact's associated deal (i.e. order) so you'd need to check for any associated deals with the status set to checkout abandoned

Hello,
I trigger a new event when a particular event occurs. Now I want to include that in a workflow, when a new item of this event is created.
But I cannot find a “new event inserted” in the workflows.
Can I trigger a workflow on a new event?

Hi guys!
I'm trying to submit a custom form through HubSpot Form API.
I get:
```Access to fetch at '<https://forms.HubSpot.com/uploads/form/v2/XXXXXXXX/277fa94c-a1de-4623-85ac-a35cadccb8a7>' from origin '<https://pro.chronogolf.com>' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.
```
Our domain (<http://pro.chronogolf.com|pro.chronogolf.com>) is registred under HubSpot  - so i'm not sur what i need to do
Hey <@UJ7ARFV2S> The v3 version of the endpoint supports CORS.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>  If use that endpoint instead this should work

I wonder if there’s a way to get it 60-70% there... where it automatically creates all the GF fields in HubSpot. Then the user would have to just assemble the form/logic. 

Wouldn’t be ideal, but would still be a big time saver

I have a template that is displaying this code in the source of the page:
<!-- Missing Template at Path: ‘/Blank.html’ -->, does anyone know how to fix this
Heya <@UF6M5BW4C>, wanna DM me the details and I can take a look?
its seems to be resolved now, must have been the SSL activation process just taking longer than normal
Hi, I set a link to logo of site on HubSpot, but each post has configured other link, how I can change this link without update each post
Does anyone know if its possible to add custom modules in the flow of the body content of a blog post?
